This is wonderful news. A person's chance of having an adverse reaction to a vaccine (beyond any transient symptom like a fever or discomfort) is about 1 in 1,000,000. To put that in perspective, your lifetime risk of being struck by lightning is 1 in 12,000. Your chance of dying in a plane crash is about 1 in 20,000 and your chance of death in a skydiving accident is 1 in 100,000. Hell your chance of death at a disco is 1 in 100,000. Your chance of dying after contracting measles is around 1 in 300-500. This is a common response among those that do not fully understand evolution and resistance mechanisms. A virus faced with antibodies against its spike protein will mutate in such a way as to evade those antibodies. The spike protein is also what the virus uses to infect human cells, i.e. determines its infectiousness. If a virus mutates in such a way that it escapes the antibody but also screws up its infectiousness, it will die off. So by definition, what you will have left are viruses that managed to evade the antibodies AND are really good at infecting and spreading.

This is a common response among those that do not fully understand evolution and resistance mechanisms. A virus faced with antibodies against its spike protein will mutate in such a way as to evade those antibodies. The spike protein is also what the virus uses to infect human cells, i.e. determines its infectiousness. If a virus mutates in such a way that it escapes the antibody but also screws up its infectiousness, it will die off. So by definition, what you will have left are viruses that managed to evade the antibodies AND are really good at infecting and spreading.

I think the ruling last week by the german constitutional court really created the path towards it. Under the German constitution, every governmental action has to follow the principle of proportionality, meaning that you need a due cause, based on the constitution, the restrict the freedoms granted by the constitution. Until now, it was not really clear how much the constitutional court would permit for covid measures, and under which guidelines the constitutional court would accept these often very invasive actions. With the ruling last week, the constitutional court made clear that, to fight such a pandemic, the government can do quite a lot as long as the danger is high enough and recognized by the parliament. This created a pathway for mandatory vaccines where the government can be reasonably sure that it won't burn in front of the constitutional court.

Look, I'll concede that if you're not familiar with vaccines or the process that they go through before being authorized then it can seem scary or risky. But you have to realize that these trials aren't just done all willy-nilly. The FDA has been intimately involved, and set the timelines for the trials specifically to hedge against long-term effects. All of our historical evidence and research points out that if a long term effect were to occur from a vaccine, it would be within 6 weeks - so the FDA mandated that trials must last at least 2 months. Also, though the vaccine hasn't been "out" for the public for that long, it's incorrect to assume we haven't been studying the problem for that long. Trials and research have been occurring since early 2020.

Look, I'll concede that if you're not familiar with vaccines or the process that they go through before being authorized then it can seem scary or risky. But you have to realize that these trials aren't just done all willy-nilly. The FDA has been intimately involved, and set the timelines for the trials specifically to hedge against long-term effects. All of our historical evidence and research points out that if a long term effect were to occur from a vaccine, it would be within 6 weeks - so the FDA mandated that trials must last at least 2 months. Also, though the vaccine hasn't been "out" for the public for that long, it's incorrect to assume we haven't been studying the problem for that long. Trials and research have been occurring since early 2020.

OSHA is a government entity under the Department of Labor that writes specific workplace regulations that OSHA enforce, not cops. You get that right limited by section 1 - the reasonable limits clause applies to all sections of the charter.  Furthermore, section 7 only guarantees those rights "in accordance with the principals of fundamental justice". So the courts may very well come down with a judgement that it's a reasonable limits to your right to security of the person to have mandatory vaccines. Or, they may decide that it is a principal of fundamental justice to not put others at risk due to a lack of vaccination.  It's more complicated than just the section you quoted.

There are more than a few thousand strains or serovars for Salmonella.  A vaccine that would work for Salmonella typhi may not work for Salmonella typhimurium or Salmonella enteritidis. Also Salmonella typhi is restricted to human hosts.  These serovars have a "preference" on host range they infect.  Some are generalists while others like Typhimurium are more associated with mammalian hosts.  Salmonella enteritidis is what you would generally encounter in poultry.   I don't know which part of Salmonella is used in the vaccine but if it was the flagella, then there would be variability between the various serovars.  Unless the vaccine can offer cross-protection between serovars (again I don't know much about the vaccine, I just started studying Salmonella), I wouldn't trust eating that raw or undercooked chicken.

Very young children cannot be vaccinated. Immunocompromised people cannot be vaccinated, and any vaccination they have previously received (if they were healthy enough to receive one before) becomes ineffective. Some healthy people may receive a vaccination and it just doesn't stick, for whatever reason.  Ordinarily, if everyone who is able to be is vaccinated, these at-risk people who cannot be vaccinated would benefit from herd immunity and their chances of contracting the disease is slim-to-none. However, as the percentage of unvaccinated people in a population rises, the disease is able to spread through the population and infect these at-risk individuals.
